intro: Hedyotis camarinensis, commonly known as the Philippine balsam, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its flowers are usually white or pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and gardens.
